name: HACK_IT
description: HACK_IT presents players with a fully immersive hacking experience, you’ll meet characters and find out things you never imagined. Including interactive apps that will give you the power to shutdown servers and retrieve passwords.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 2.0 GHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: Intel integrated graphics 3000 DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: Any
recommended_requirements: OS: Win 7 / Win 8 / Win 10 Processor: 3.0 GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Intel integrated graphics 4000 DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 300 MB available space Sound Card: Any

reviews.review_text: the definition of mediocrity. from the screens and description you might expect a fun uplink-type hacking sim or something like that, but it's actually a bad visual novel with poor editing and tedious minigames. also the screen effects gave me a headache. like just buy a new monitor ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ there's no way a virus can cause these effects, do you live inside of a thunderstorm  anyway it's not very good.

DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. HACK_IT seemed at first to be an interesting concept, with hacking being a cool idea for a game and intriguing to me since I played the ironically far superior hacking flash game 'Hacker' on addictinggames.   This game wasn't worth the price in any capacity. It tried to be funny, but it was not funny in the slightest. It tried to be meaningful, but instead of having meaning it turned out to be meaningless. It failed on the one thing I expected for it when I bought it. You don't hack in this game. You press one button and listen to the people responding to you. (In total there are only 3 substantial characters. You, VirusMan, and K0nsole. The other characters are either VirusMan pretending, or blue screen nonsense...  I give this game a 4/10, because while it was an interesting waste of time, it was only to see if it was going to eventually get better. It did not.   The music is pretty okay though.
A waste of money. You pretty much are paying the dev to to troll you, by buying this game.
It is an interesting, if simple game. not much skill needed to progress. Can get repeatitive
Its not much of a game. I thought you would actually be the one who imputs stuff, but just press buttons once and awhile.

The game is too linear for me and not near as fun as I had expected. It is more or less a clicking game than anything. I'd suggest playing Hacknet as it's a far better game IMO.   I requested a refund for now, but may purchase the game again in the future during a sale or something.
